meanings.definition: The teachings or methods of the Scholastics.
meanings.sent1: In history class, we learned about the scholasticisms of the ancient philosophers.
meanings.sent2: The professor's lecture on scholasticisms was enlightening and informative.
meanings.sent3: The students found humor in the scholasticisms of the old textbooks.
meanings.sent4: Her approach to problem-solving was like unraveling the complex web of scholasticisms.
meanings.sent5: The library was filled with dusty tomes on scholasticisms, waiting to be explored.

meanings.definition: Excessive adherence to traditional methods or rules in education or scholarship.
meanings.sent1: The school's strict scholasticisms stifled creativity among the students.
meanings.sent2: Breaking free from scholasticisms can lead to innovative breakthroughs.
meanings.sent3: The debate team's rigid adherence to scholasticisms made their arguments sound outdated.
meanings.sent4: She felt trapped by the suffocating blanket of scholasticisms in her field of study.
meanings.sent5: The new curriculum aimed to shake off the shackles of scholasticisms and embrace modern teaching methods.
